title: When will investors learn? It’s time to stop hyping up star stock pickers like Woodford
text:
How the mighty are fallen. Neil Woodford has finally given up on the retail investment business. After several years of increasingly dire performance, sparking a potential lawsuit against Hargreaves Lansdown and a Financial Conduct Authority investigation, his his flagship fund is finally being liquidated.

Once again, it begs the question: how many times are investors going to fall for the same old trick? In defiance of prudence, logic and experience, we keep betting on the idea that a big name can reliably beat the market, when it’s just not so.

Woodford has been endlessly marketed as a “contrarian”, a “star fund manager” and even “Britain’s answer to Warren Buffett”. What he is, in fact, is...
